roleset.name: point
roleset.note: POINT-V NOTES: Frames file for 'point' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No access to verbnet. No comparison. (from point.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: toward
example.text: Trading is expected to remain subdued as the market awaits tomorrow's release of the jobs data with the hope that it will point toward a decline in interest rates.
example.arg: toward a decline in interest rates

example.name: to
example.text: ``I believe everyday pricing in the current environment doesn't work,'' says [Walter Loeb of Morgan Stanley& Co.]-1, *trace*-1 pointing to soft durable-goods sales.

example.name: at
example.text: They point at the numerous developing-country governments that have inflated, taxed and regulated themselves into despair under successive IMF programs.
example.arg: the numerous developing-country governments that have inflated, taxed and regulated themselves into despair under successive IMF programs

example.name: with arg1
example.text: John pointed the toy gun at the giant menacing alien and said, "Hasta la vista, bay-bee."

roleset.name: have a particular goal or destiny; be intended for something

role.descr: smaller actions that are intended for that goal

example.name: point-n
example.text: Is there any point to continuing this?

example.name: have_point-l: typical usage
example.text: What point does this have?

example.name: point-n: typical usage
example.text: I see no point in doing this

example.name: make_point-l: typical usage
example.text: John mades a very good point that pizza is a vegetable

roleset.name: be certain to do/accomplish
roleset.note: POINT-N NOTES: framed by Tim during MWE annotation

example.name: make_point-l: typical usage
example.text: There is just something wrong with *PRO*-1 making a point of being a jerkass .

roleset.name: non-predicative use of point; score in a game or sharp bit of an object
roleset.note: POINT-N NOTES: framed by Tim during MWE annotation

roleset.name: point at, define, make an example of

example.name: typical usage
example.text: Drexel Burnham's Mr. Reidy pointed out that ``profits held up in a tough revenue environment.''
example.arg: that profits held up in a tough revenue environment

roleset.name: assign blame

mappings.source: (A / point-01 :arg0 (n / NARG0) :arg1 (B / finger :poss n) :arg2 (n2 / NARG1) :subevent-of (a / accuse-01 :arg0 n :arg1 n3 :arg2 (n3 / NARG2)))

roleset.note: POINT_FINGER-M NOTES: Prepped by Tim during MWE framing

role.descr: event providing evidence for the finger-pointing

example.name: point_finger-m: normal
example.text: It's hard, though, to really point the finger at somebody when they're not here to defend themselves.
example.arg: when they're not here to defend themselves

example.name: point_finger-m: arg2
example.text: She stated that she was not here to point the finger at anyone for her always-healthy little girl Stacey's being so sick with leukemia.
example.arg: for her always-healthy little girl Stacey's being so sick with leukemia.

roleset.name: speak based upon pre-existing arguments (potentially provided by others)
roleset.note: TALKING_POINT-M NOTES: Added during AMR retrofits for MWE framing

example.name: with arg4
example.text: And he used the Planned Parenthood talking points, saying that abortions, several hundred thousand a year, are a very small portion of what they actually do.
example.arg: saying that abortions, several hundred thousand a year, are a very small portion of what they actually do.

example.name: point_finger-m: arg2
example.text: I, I'm sure you saw Liz Cheney said, Rand Paul seems to get his foreign policy talking points from Rachel Maddow.

roleset.name: have a particular perspective upon an issue
roleset.note: POV-M NOTES: Added during AMR retrofits for MWE framing

role.descr: Person who has a view point
actual point of view or stance
kind of point of view; characterization of viewer

example.name: with arg4
example.text: I realize your take on this is strictly from a patriotic point of view

example.name: point_finger-m: arg2
example.text: Look at it from the lender's point of view

roleset.name: be correct
roleset.note: Have-Point-M NOTES: Added during AMR retrofits for MWE framing
If it just means "is making a claim", use point.04

example.name: with arg1
example.text: Romney has a point that young Americans are hurting in today's job market.
example.arg: that young Americans are hurting in today's job market

example.name: with arg0
example.text: but the president has a point there.

roleset.name: exemplify, be a good example of a generalization
roleset.note: CASE-IN-Point-M NOTES: Added during AMR retrofits for MWE framing

example.name: with arg1
example.text: But, more and more, it's becoming digital, case in point, this week's efforts by the White House to promote the president's State of the Union agenda on social media sites like Facebook, Twitter and YouTube.
example.arg: more and more, it's becoming digital
this week's efforts by the White House to promote the president's State of the Union agenda on social media sites like Facebook, Twitter and YouTube.

example.name: just arg0
example.text: Case in point: Male squash bees hide away inside bright orange squash flowers late in the day, and then the blossom closes up around the sleeping bees as night falls, protecting them from predators.
example.arg: Male squash bees hide away inside bright orange squash flowers late in the day, and then the blossom closes up around the sleeping bees as night falls, protecting them from predators.
